word: At Home With the Andrews Family.--Our home is in Paris, at Brother Andrews' [home], within a few steps of the post office and printing office. We shall stay here some little time. This is a very kind family, yet quite poor. Everything here is free as far as they have.--Letter 28, 1850, p. 1. (To "The Church in Brother Hastings' house," Nov. 7, 1850.)
